IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE COUNCIL PROVIDES ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION PROGRAMS IN COLLEGES AND UNIVERSITIES THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CAEP ADVANCES EQUITY AND EXCELLENCE IN EDUCATOR PREPARATION THROUGH EVIDENCE-BASED ACCREDITATION THAT ASSURES QUALITY AND SUPPORTS CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT TO STRENGTHEN P-12 STUDENT LEARNING.
IRS990.Desc: ACCREDITATION: THE COUNCIL CONDUCTS ON-SITE VISITS BY STAFF AND VOLUNTEER SITE VISITORS. 500 COUNCIL SITE VISITORS PARTICIPATED IN 98 VISITS DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: EXTERNAL RELATIONS AND OUTREACH: PROVIDE COMMUNICATION, MARKETING, AND MEMBER RELATIONS FUNCTIONS FOR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL CONSTITUENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: CONFERENCES: THE COUNCIL COORDINATED ONE VIRTUAL CONFERENCE DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022 FOR THOSE IN THE EDUCATION FIELD, PREDOMINANTLY EDUCATION PREPARATION PROVIDERS, TO ATTEND SESSIONS REGARDING THE COUNCIL'S ACCREDITATION PROCESS. THE VIRTUAL CONFERENCE HAD OVER 1,230 ATTENDEES DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2022.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART III, LINE 12, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: REFUNDS/ADJUSTMENTS - 2017 AMOUNT: $ 23,950. 2018 AMOUNT: $ 48,331. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 1,635. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 7,043. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 22,851. MISC INCOME - 2019 AMOUNT: $ 2,926. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 8,899. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 3,490.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE COUNCIL BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THAT WOULD HAVE AN EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS. THERE ARE NO UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS OR LIABILITIES THAT NEED TO BE RECORDED.
AS PART OF THE PRESIDENT'S CONTRACT, THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES A $1,000/MONTH HOUSING ALLOWANCE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CONSTITUENT MEMBERS OF THE COUNCIL FOR THE ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION, INC. ARE PROFESSIONAL ASSOCIATIONS THAT REPRESENT THE FOLLOWING FOUR "QUADRANT' GROUPS: TEACHER EDUCATION, TEACHERS, STATE AND LOCAL POLICY MAKERS, AND PROFESSIONAL SPECIALTY GROUPS. THERE ARE NO CLASSES OF MEMBERSHIP. EACH QUADRANT COLLECTIVELY APPOINTS SIX MEMBERS OF THE COUNCIL FOR THE ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION, INC.'S GOVERNING BODY, ITS EXECUTIVE BOARD, WHICH ALSO INCLUDES ONE PUBLIC MEMBER AND FOUR MEMBERS DRAWN FROM THE COUNCIL FOR THE ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION, INC.'S OTHER POLICY BOARDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMBERS OF THE COUNCIL FOR THE ACCREDITATION OF EDUCATOR PREPARATION, INC. ELECT THE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE PRESIDENT AND CFO REVIEW THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS SIGNED BY THE PRESIDENT AND FILED WITH THE IRS. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE FULL BOARD AT THEIR NEXT SCHEDULED BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION REVIEWS THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ANNUALLY AT THE ORGANIZATION MEETING WITH THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND REQUIRES DISCLOSURE OF ANY INTERESTS THAT MAY PRESENT A CONFLICT OF INTEREST. THE STAFF ARE ALSO EXPECTED TO MAINTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND PRACTICES IN THEIR CAEP ACTIVITIES THAT ARE LEGAL, PROFESSIONAL, ETHICAL, AND MORALLY CORRECT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION USES A COMPENSATION SURVEY AND AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT TO DETERMINE THE TOP MANAGEMENT OFFICIAL'S COMPENSATION AND IT IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE LAST REVIEW OF THE PRESIDENT'S COMPENSATION WAS IN JULY OF 2021. THE COMPENSATION OF OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEE IS DETERMINED BY THE PRESIDENT AND REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT THE BOARD MEETING. THE LAST DETERMINATION OF COMPENSATION FOR OTHER OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEE WAS ALSO IN JULY OF 2021.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY REQUEST.
THE ORGANIZATION HAS NOT CHANGED ITS OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR PROCESS DURING THE YEAR.
